IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE PROMOTION OF HEALTHCARE FOR THE RESIDENTS AND VISITORS TO THE CITY OF YERINGTON AND LYON COUNTY, NEVADA.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The mission of south lyon medical center is to provide access to health care services needed by the community.
IRS990.Description: The Hospital is a 14-bed acute hospital with 24 hour emergency room, full service lab, and x-ray departments. The E/R sees approximately 300 patients a month. Close communications with larger facilities and specialists in many disciplines allow both helicopter and air ambulance services to take patients to those hospitals within a short amount of time. Hospital has a sliding fee scale and assistance available for completing applications. The hospital provides the standard influenza vaccine at a nominal cost. The hospital provides the H1N1 vaccine free of charge to all who want it.

Activity2.Description: The long term care program is a medicare approved 49-bed skilled nursing and long term care facility with in-house physical therapy available. Staff to patient ratio is above required. A social worker/resident advocate and an enthusiastic activities program make our ltc one of the finest anywhere.

Activity3.Description: The clinics program consists of three rural health clinics. We have five physicians and three nurse practitioners that work out of our clinics to serve the needs of the community. Our barnett clinic is a walk-in clinic available at convenient hours for our patients who need to see a provider immediately or who do not have a regular doctor.All clinics offer services at a reduced fee for those who need it. A financial counselor is available for assistance at all times. The clinics provide the H1N1 vaccine free of charge to any who want it and provide the standard vaccine at a nominal cost.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: The organization is a member of Nevada Hospital Association. $341 is 10.63% of Membership dues to Nevada Hospital Association used for lobbying.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The organization recorded no assets or liabilities for uncertain tax positions or unrecognized tax benefits. Federal returns for the years ended 2007, 2008, and 2009 remain subject to examination by major tax jurisdictions.

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CostingMethodUsed: Part I, Line 7: The costing methodology is the cost to charge ratio.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: Part III, Line 4: The carrying amounts of patient receivables are reduced by allowances that reflect management's best estimate of the amounts that will be collected. Management provides for contractual adjustments under terms of third-party reimbursement agreements through a reduction of gross revenue and a credit to patient receivables. In addition, management provides for probable uncollectible amounts, primarily uninsured patients and amounts patients are personally responsible for, through a charge to operations and a credit to the allowance for doubtful accounts based on its assessment of historical collection likelihood and the current status of individual accounts. Balances that are still outstanding after management has used reasonable collection efforts are written off though a charge to the allowance for doubtful accounts and a credit to patient accounts receivable.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.ShortfallAsCommunityBenefit: Part III, Line 8: The costing methodology used to determine the medicare allowable cost reported in the Medicare cost report is the cost to charge ratio.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.DebtCollectionPolicy: Part III, Line 9b: Emergency room patients without a payment source may be classified as charity if they do not have a job, mailing address, residence, or insurance. Consideration must also be given to classifying emergency room only patients who do not provide adequate information as to their financial status. In many instances, these patients are homeless and have few resources to cover the cost of their care.If a collection agency identifies a patient meeting the hospital's charity care eligibility criteria, their patient account may be considered charity care, even if they were originally classified as a bad debt. Collection agency patient accounts meeting charity care criteria should be returned to the hospital billing office and reviewed for charity care eligibility.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.GeneralExplanation: Part I, Line 7, column FAs allowed, the denominator has been reduced by $1,095,593, the amount of bad debt reported in Part IX, line 25 of Form 990.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: Part VI, Line 2: There are several ways that South Lyon Medical Center assesses the healthcare needs of the community. Some of the best information comes directly from listening to patients that use the facility and the physicians that are employed here. Other ways the assessments are done are: holding community meetings (including the annual meeting of the Membership), feedback from community groups and the SLMC Auxiliary, and via the Office of Rural Health at the University of Nevada Reno.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: Part VI, Line 3: Public notice of the availability of assistance through the charity care policy are made through each of the following means:1. Posting notices in a visible manner in locations where there is a high volume of inpatient or outpatient admitting/registration, such as emergency departments, billing offices, admitting offices, and hospital outpatient service settings.2. Including information in the bills sent to uninsured patients statements indicating: a.) If the patient meets certain income requirements, the patient may be eligible for a government-sponsored program or for financial assistance from the hospital. b.) A hospital phone number that patients may call for further information.3. Posting notice of the availability of assistance and a contact phone number on the SLMC web site.4. Providing uninsured patients information outlining the types of financial assistance available.Posted notices (as listed above) shall be in the primary language(s) of SLMC's service area and in a manner consistent with all applicable federal and state laws and regulations. Posted notices shall contain the following information:1. A statement indicating that the hospital has a financial assistance policy for low-income uninsured patients who may not be able to pay their bill and that this policy provides for full or partial charity care write-off.2. Identification of a hospital contact phone number that the patient can call to obtain more information about the policy and about how to apply for assistance.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: Part VI, Line 4: The area served by our facility consists of the City of Yerington, and communities of Mason, Smith, Wellington and Schurz. The total population of the Mason Valley-Yerington area is approximately 10,000. The median age is 40.9 with 12% of the population over 65. 75% of the population is white with over 12% hispanic. The median salary is $32,000 per household. The primary industry is agriculture with the largest employers being public (city, county and state) with the school system and hospital in the top 4.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityBuildingActivities: Part VI, Line 5: There are a variety of activities that SLMC does to promote health in the community, including holding community health fairs (offering reduced cost or free services), providing space for medical specialists for local visits, providing access to medical information via the Cares Cottage, providing diabetic education to community members and via outreach programs with the local schools. Many of these programs are not easy or cost effective to track in our accounting system and therefore are not reported.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.OtherInformation: Part VI, Line 6: SLMC has a community based Board of Directors; an open medical staff and uses surplus funds to pay for community services such as health fairs, space for medical specialists for local visits, providing access to medical information via the Cares Cottage, providing diabetic education to community members and via outreach programs with the local schools.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization has members with unlimited terms elected by a vote of a majority of the board of directors. The members are required to meet annually and must be residents of the south lyon hospital district. Membership is not transferable or assignable.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION HAS MEMBERS WITH UNLIMITED TERMS ELECTED BY A VOTE OF A MAJORITY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO MEET ANNUALLY AND MUST BE RESIDENTS OF THE SOUTH LYON HOSPITAL DISTRICT. MEMBERSHIP IS NOT TRANSFERABLE OR ASSIGNABLE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Form 990 is reviewed by the CEO of the organization.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY. ADMINISTRATION AND RISK MANAGEMENT REVIEW FILES FOR SIGNATURES AND DISCLOSURES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Compensation of the CEO, top management and officers of the organization is determined by using Surveys from the Nevada Hospital Association, Nevada Rural Hospital Partners, MGMA, Merritt Hawkins and other professional survey instruments.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public and announces such at board meetings and the annual south lyon hospital district corporation meeting.
The Finance Committee of the Board of Directors assumes responsibility for the audit of its financial statements and selection of an independent accountant.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: Provides support ot South Lyon Medical Center
provides support ot South Lyon Medical Center
